Description: Small body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup, possibly a cup with everted rim; interior: trace of black band and reserved zone; exterior: trace of reserved band and black zone; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer suggests that the sherd belongs to a Type 9 South Ionian cup with everted rim. The lack of rim and other diagonstic features makes it impossible to confirm the type to which the cup belongs. Type 9 cups have been found in large numbers at in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus. This type was the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18).
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 54, no. 17)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.260) (Phase 3)
